Reviews.Title: Great while it worked
Reviews.Author: Sara in Chicago
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just before I went on my honeymoon in Mexico. I specifically wanted a waterproof but stylish camera and this fit the bill perfectly. Over all this camera is pretty easy to use once you got use to the interface. There were a lot of preset options so it was easy to switch from panoramic to low light etc. We took countless panoramics with it which turned out great. The panoramic feature is really easy to use. We went on zip line excursions and rafted through water filled caves. The light in the caves were too low for the camera to work so we had to use the flash which made the background too dark and washed out any people in the photos. We got to zipline through waterfalls and I used the camcorder function to capture it. We took photos under water in the pools at the resort and they come out nicely. A bit of water got under the touch screen after a few trips in the pool. This didn't affect the touch screens functionality but was annoying to look at when reviewing your photos.After about 2 days being in and out of water, the red paint that covers the slide started to flake off. The camera still worked just fine but I was pretty bummed about the camera being half red and half silver. We got home from the honeymoon and uploaded all of our photos and videos successfully. Then I put the camera away for a month or so and pulled it back out to take on a ski trip. I suppose something happened in the month time frame that the right side of the touch screen stopped working. The right side had all the preset functions so I couldn't switch from low light into any other mode. I sent the camera to Sony repair hoping for them to fix it or replace it. I got a call about a month after I sent it from Sony saying they didn't have the components needed to fix it and that they have ordered them but they would take 3 months to get to the warehouse. They gave me two options, wait 3 months to get my paint chipped red TX-5 or they could send me a brand new TX-9. The TX-9 is a higher model but is not waterproof, which was my main reason for getting the TX-5. I should be getting it in the mail any day now.Overall I was very happy with the TX-5 performance while it was working. Great point and shoot with some fancy features but easy to use. I'm just really disappointed the TX-5 didn't last very long but I am happy with Sony's customer service. If you need your camera repaired quickly...you might not feel the same.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: frustrated user
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a vacation to Jamaica. Hauled it around constantly and took it snorkeling and in the pool. It's been underwater for a total of about 6 hours or so. No problems. Picture and movie quality is good. It's quite light and compact. The only negatives I can say are that the paint is flaking off of the sliding cover in the front, and I couldn't get the "panorama" mode to work at all.It's generally good in jittery and low light situations. There were very few blurry photos that came of the more challenging shooting conditions.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-TX5 -Very Satisfied with Purchase
Reviews.Author: Jim L. in FL
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife who only usually will take pictures when we are away on a trip. She has found the camera to be most portable & now carries it all the time in her purse. Because of past infrequent use of cameras she had difficulty navigating the different menu items- but with this touch screen it is a different world for her.  It is now much easier for her to access the menu options. I think the image quality is very good especially in low light.  The battery life is more than adequate & the panaramic feature is marvelous. It is a camera full of features that won't become obsolete in a short time as so many do.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Pittman
Reviews.Content: This is my third Sony Cybershot and I love them!  I purchased this for a recent vacation to the Caribbean and wanted a waterproof camera.  This one held up well with all of our adventures and took great underwater pictures.  Just be cautious that the lens fogs up when going from underwater picture-taking to out-of-water picture-taking, so you'll need to wipe the lens first for a clear picture.  The details of the pictures are better than my older Cybershots which comes in handy for the following drawback:  The initial setting of focus places the subjects at quite a distance (much more than my other Cybershots.)  So even when taking pictures of someone/something a few feet away, it is neccessary to zoom in if you want your subject to fill the screen.  Personally, I found this to be a bit of a pain.  Overall, though, I love this camera and would purchase it again.  It functioned as well as I had hoped for the price.  In response to those who claim the battery life is too short - we didn't have too much trouble.  We charged the battery each night, but were able to utilize the camera for a full day of fun in between charges.  That said, we didn't use up battery life looking through the pictures we had taken until we were back to our room for fear of draining it before the day was done.  Oh, and one more thing.... the description SAYS "red", but the color is MOST DEFINATELY raspberry-pink!  I'm okay with it because I love pink, but I would have been disappointed if I had my heart set on red.

Reviews.Title: Neat, compact, and handy
Reviews.Author: yumin
Reviews.Content: I bought this neat camera for my wife and five-years-old daughter for pool and beache activities this summer.  It has been a really helpful device to record every exciting moments, such as the situation of ocean waves splashing on us, paranoma scenes, or even recording the pretty underwater scenes in the pool.  Sony TX5 has done a great job.  My daughter right now knows better how to perform this camera more than us.  I suppose the touch-screen features are quite easy to understand, even for a girl of five years old.  In essential, I like this compact camera.  However, it has to be noted of two exceptions:1) The edge distortion of this 24 mm len is quite severe.  You have to adjust for yourself not getting a strange image, specially on faces of your family.  You might be able to ignore this problem in the case of when you snap on the large and tall buildings.2) The sliding lid on the front will get some beach sands inside.  It is very hard to get those sands out.  I have tried to blow it with hair dryer, but in vain.Except for these two, I satisfy with this real compact, low-light capturing, and pretty camera.  So does all of my family! :D

Reviews.Title: Quick and rugged
Reviews.Author: suburban boy
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes great jpg pictures, is very, very quick to focus and shoot, and is great in low light situations. It is not as good as a DSLR, but they won't fit in your pocket, and are not waterproof to 5 meters. Have not used the video option yet. Flash seems to be adequate for close in people shots. This little Sony replaced a four year old Pentax water proof. No regrets and it is quick to shoot. It has traveled to Kentucky, Indiana, Illinois, Michigan, Paris (France) and Barcelona (Spain). No problems. I will try to update later if there are any reliability issues.

Reviews.Title: I am very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: N. Zhang
Reviews.Content: I got it about a month ago and I couldn't be happier with a camera. I have taken pictures in the late evening and tried its sweep paronomic mode. It is fantastic and I received lots of complements on my pictures from friends. I got the red color because it is really fashionable and sexy. It is small and the touch screen works like a charm. I got a leather case to protect it and carry it along with me almost all the times. I recommend it to anyone without reservation.

Reviews.Title: Camera image stablelizer failed after 1.5 years
Reviews.Author: Mei Shen
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for about 1.5 years. It has been great taken pictures near waterfalls, damp places, in pool water and very easy to carry and use. The paint on the cover started to chip away little by little about 8 months into usage. But that is not important to me since it does not impacting the images. But today, the real problem happened! Halfway into my hiking, the camera started to shake whenever I turn it on. I can hear the motor turning sound in the camera. Searching on line tonight, I found many people have the same problem with other Sony models as well. And they said it is the image stablelizer failed. Rightnow, only panorama mode works.Sony.com said this means the camera need to be repaired. Someone said the repair could cost more than $100.I'm very sad the camera is not useful any more.

Reviews.Title: Great all-around camera!
Reviews.Author: tiger23
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is my 4th Sony Cybershot and I have not ever wanted to get a different brand. I selected this one because I'm rough on my cameras. It's tougher than the standard cybershot, I've dropped it several times with no issue. Also, the new panorama picture feature is awesome. I've taken a few scenery type pictures that turned out great! The other feature I use often is the low light picture help. I take a lot of pictures without flash because I believe the flash often ruins the picture. My low-light photos have turned out very nice! I also take videos with this camera, it really does everything! The only thing I miss from other cybershots is the ability to take a black and white photo or sepia style photo. I'm sure most photo editing software can take care of that though.

Reviews.Title: Learn from My Mistake
Reviews.Author: Pi
Reviews.Content: For anyone contemplating on buying this camera. Please test out the underwater feature immediately. I thought I had 30 days (from shipping date) to test and return/exchange the camera if defective. I tested mine too late (past the 15 day return policy of Amazon seller Abt Electronics). I tested mine in a swimming pool less than 1 foot and under a minute. It left a penny-sized mark on the bottom right corner of my LCD screen like the water seeped through. After using underwater, I soaked the camera for 5 minutes in pure water (per instruction from the manual, I presumed distilled) and followed the cleaning/drying instructions. The mark is still there despite being completely dry. The camera still works including the area of the LCD with the waterlike seepage mark. But who would like this mark on an LCD screen of a brand new underwater camera? My fear is this will eventually get worse (meaning camera not well sealed). I would hate to have this brand new camera opened for repair but I don't have a choice. So off to Sony repair center this goes. Hopefully they will fix this right and not make things worse. For now I'm giving it 3 stars and will update after repair.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!
Reviews.Author: tammy
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera I have had it for a few months. It has been through a.few drops, underwater pics and it is still working great takes great photos and turns on very quickly. Photo quality.is amazing. A must buy for those who vacation often and want to take pictures on mountaint tops in the pool or ocean and drop resistant also. Not afraid to let my kids handle it. One of the best cameras.

Reviews.Title: Happily surprised
Reviews.Content: I work in ceramics so I wanted a camera that could deal with dust. This is perfect. I was surprised with the ease of use and the quality of the images. I am also very happy with the amount of options for different situations and conditions. The camera turns on right away and is in the last mode that you used. It is really an amazing little camera. The battery does seem to run out faster than other cameras I have had. I carry two batteries so no problem. Using this camera I don't have to ask people to smile using this camera. I am a large man and people always smile when they see my Barbi pink camera come out. I thought it was red but it is really more Barbi Pink.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money, takes pictures quickly
Reviews.Author: Steve from Tewksbury
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best point-and-shoot camera I have ever owned. It focuses and takes the picture so fast. Cheaper and older cameras I have owned had a noticeable and annoying delay before actually taking the shot. My wife always complained. We were going to Swim with the Dolphins on our upcoming vacation so I chose this model. I am so satisfied with it. Buy the Orange floating strap from Sony to go with it. Makes taking it in the water stress-free. Also the panorama shots are so cool. By the way, the Wet and Wild Park in Cancun Mexico was the best Dolphin experience we've had so far. My wife has gone to 5 different places in Cancun over the past years and this was her best time yet. I also liked it because it included admission to the water park and all you could eat and drink (alcohol too) for a very reasonable price ($120 USD)

Reviews.Title: Sony Camera is loved
Reviews.Author: Thaddeus Pajk
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my 20yr old Daughter.  From day one she loved it.  It goes everyplace with her.  The pictures are great and although she hasn't grasped all the cool features what she does know works great. I hope to expand her use and knowledge of the camera.  It has all the features she needs to know and it's easy to learn on. It seems to be surviving her idea of good care.  It's durable.

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: jcmck
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Took it on vacation worked perfect.  Great for the beach and site seeing. Only draw back was it was a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: most amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: birdie_p
Reviews.Content: this camera is awesome!  i had an older model of the camera, but it died on me so i purchased this one.  AMAZING is all i have to say.  the picture quality is awesome.  the only downfall is that the video format is mp4, which means not all computer video players can play the video.  for example, windows media player can not read the file.  if you have realplayer on your computer, that program can read mp4 files.  other than that...i highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Sony cyber shot DSC-TX5 camera
Reviews.Author: Stacie D
Reviews.Content: I had gotten this camera for my recent trip to Alaska.  I had done a lot of research and found this camera to be the best value for the money.  The best part about this camera is how fast it turns on and takes photos.  The 833 pictures I took on my trip turned out so awesome.  Everyone is amazed when I show them the photos and tell them it came from this little camera.  I can't say enough good things about it.  The touch screen makes finding options so much easier and faster.  This camera has a lot to offer in a small package.  You won't be dissappointed.

ProductInfo.Features:
Certified waterproof, dustproof, shockproof and freeze-proof
3.0-inch wide touch screen for easy operation and viewing of images and movies
10.2-megapixel "Exmor R" CMOS sensor for enhanced low-light performance
iSweep Panorama Mode captures stunning panoramic images; fast capture with 10fps at full 10.2MP resolution
Card slot for optional Memory Stick Duo media and SD media
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX5 10.2MP CMOS Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Zoom with SteadyShot Image Stabilization and 3.0 Inch Touch Screen LCD (Red)
